data.text: We had 10.2 mn gloves on board. Please excuse our mistake. The total delivery btw will be 65 mn pieces. So there are still some to pick up #Gloveliner 🧤✈️
To find the flight @flightradar24 search for OS1 or click this link: https://t.co/NEqhAZ9ve1

data.text: Over 17 hours flight time, 16,000 km distance. Our Boeing 777, the OE-LPD, just took off for the longest flight in more than 60 years of company history: nonstop from Vienna to Sydney picking up repatriates. 💪🛫🇦🇹 Follow OS 1457 live @flightradar24. https://t.co/pV7UVMybKZ

Great welcoming committee in red for our repatriation flight coming from Denpasar/Kuala Lumpur! Btw, our crew will take the OE-LPD, whose wing they are standing under, on a record flight shortly. Stay tuned! https://t.co/iVsqiKdtYB
RT @Dimitrov_Nikola: In difficult circumstances for repatriation, especially for citizens stranded on other continents, I express deep grat…

data.text: The next delivery has just landed at @flughafen_wien. This time our B777 brought 6 mn protective gloves from Penang, Malaysia, from @semperitgroup for hospitals in Austria. Special Thanks to #MargareteSchramboeck @roteskreuzat @mopriesnig and our Crew👨‍✈️ to fight #COVID19 https://t.co/pftK7AVpoH

If you need to take a repatriation flight, we kindly ask you to register @mfa_austria, check https://t.co/iglSVDWuyC and follow the social media channels and news of the Austrian Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

During the last two weeks, we flew home more than 3,500 people from all over the world. Additional repatriation flights will follow this week from Lima, Denpasar & Kuala Lumpur on behalf of @mfa_austria. Huge thanks to our great employees who made this possible! 🙏🏼 #WeAreAustrian https://t.co/UaTTCQurph
RT @ChPodoschek: Angesichts der vielen Rückholflüge ist mir wieder eingefallen, wie mich die @_austrian kurz nach 9/11 aus Amerika wieder m…
(Sorry guys, Podcast only available in German)

data.text: Das #coronavirus hat die Luftfahrt außer Gefecht gesetzt. Gänzlich? Nein! Mit großen Anstrengungen werden Menschen aus aller Welt heimgeflogen und Luftbrücken für dringend benötigte medizinische Ausrüstung aufgebaut. #Flightcast hat sich dazu umgehört: https://t.co/KUiEFl3fjA ✈️ https://t.co/H1UzaEXBJV

RT @flightradar24: Follow OE-LAE at https://t.co/ikjc08S6IW

And follow OE-LPB at https://t.co/81RzOrVNKB

Two more repatriation flights are on their way right now. The OE-LAE just took off from Delhi to Vienna. The OE-LPB is over the North Atlantic heading to Lima. The OE-LAX came from Havana yesterday after a short stop in Punta Cana waving hello to over 200 people returning home.🇦🇹 https://t.co/2GHCZi08ue

data.text: One of our Boeing 777 is currently on the way back from Xiamen fully loaded with medical equipment to help against #COVID19. After a short break in Vienna we will fly on to Rome for the final delivery. 🇮🇹🇦🇹✈️ https://t.co/9hzILg8LfY

Three of our planes are currently in the air: The OE-LAX from Punta Cana/Havanna, the OE-LPB from Mexico City/Cancun (see a picture of our great crew in Cancun below) and the OE-LAE to Colombo. The OE-LPD has just landed in Xiamen to collect another tranche of medical equipment. https://t.co/xZrEgz06W0

data.text:
RT @martinoweiss: By the way, @_austrian. Your team is doing a great job!
#repatriationflights
#heimflug
#coronavirus
#TimeToGoHome https:/…

Some impressions from our repatriation flight from Washington to Vienna for @MFA_Austria yesterday. 300 people came home with us. Many thanks to @martinoweiss & his team as well for the great help @Dulles_Airport. Two flights on the way right now to Vienna from Cancun & Havanna. https://t.co/fnnzSqrgcy

We know that the current situation is extremely challenging for all our passengers and that you have many questions regarding your travels. Here's a quick explanation of the updated rebooking options with our extensive waiver policy. Visit https://t.co/NOQlcrO8ww for more info. https://t.co/lVVmglSiYs

Big thanks to the @chinaembaustria , @roteskreuzat , @mfa_austria and @bundesheerbauer  for making the flights possible! 

Pictures: © Schleinzer, Flughafen Wien - Vienna Airport

data.text: Yesterday, two of our B777s landed @flughafen_wien coming from Xiamen. 🇨🇳🛬🇦🇹 Onboard, they carried 130t of medical supplies. Today, more than 1.5m protective masks & 450k protective suits will be shipped to Tyrol & South Tyrol by the #Bundesheer. #COVID19 #TeamÖsterreich https://t.co/jtfBBlKxmN
RT @martinoweiss: Wow, we have a packed flight, all on board. @_austrian, OS 1022, Washington D.C. to Vienna is good to go. Time to go home…

data.text: The moment our CEO @AHoensbroech welcomes our pilots bringing medical equipment from Xiamen, China, to Austria and Italy #coronavirus. Watch the greeting! 🇨🇳🛬🇦🇹 Thanks ambassador @li_xiaosi, @roteskreuzat @MFA_Austria and @Bundesheerbauer for making the flights possible! https://t.co/VYpMzQFYdy
We are happy to help, Mr. President! 🇦🇹✈️ https://t.co/czGzQXVlmH

Most of our aircraft are currently taking a break @flughafen_wien. But we'll be back to greet you with a charming "Servus". Because this is no "Goodbye" - it's just a "See you later"! 🇦🇹

#WeAreAustrian #NoGoodByeSeeYouLater https://t.co/RsfwxgoKDM

“We kindly ask our passengers for their patience in light of the waiting times in processing their inquiries. I ensure everyone involved that our service employees will handle the rebooking of flights and requests as quickly as possible”, says Austrian Airlines CCO Andreas Otto.

Austrian Airlines originally announced a temporary cessation of its scheduled air traffic until 28 March 2020. Affected passengers will be rebooked on other airlines if possible. Passengers can also rebook their tickets or suspend them until 31 August 2020.

The worldwide entry bans imposed as a consequence of the coronavirus have not been relaxed and there is still little demand for air travel. For this reason, Austrian Airlines will cease all regular flight operations until 19 April 2020. https://t.co/iIvvufq1Sm

Passengers who have booked through travel agencies are kindly asked to contact them for rebooking. If you have purchased your tickets directly at Austrian Airlines you can contact our Service Center by telephone or via the contact form on our website: https://t.co/1HQXp3B92c

Current developments are leading to a sharp increase in the number of customer requests at our Service Centers. This is currently resulting in longer waiting times for processing. Therefore, rebooking is also possible after the planned flight has passed.
In case of rebooking, the ticket value increases by € 50,-. The regulation applies to existing and cancelled flights on the entire worldwide route network of Austrian Airlines.

The value of the ticket remains unchanged. Until this date, customers have time to announce a new departure date. The new journey must be started by 31 December 2020 latest. The destination can also be changed free of charge as part of this waiver policy.

data.text: Due to the developments surrounding the spread of the coronavirus, Austrian Airlines is again extending its waiver policy and prolonging the free rebooking options for passengers. Tickets that were or will be booked up until 31 March 2020 can be suspended until 31 August 2020. https://t.co/TBvCnmJ8on
RT @AHoensbroech: The two @_austrian B777 landed safely in Xiamen, China, today. I would like to thank Ambassador @li_xiaosi. Without his s…
🙏 https://t.co/c44U9fYKPl
This website is for all repatriation flights, not only those of Austrian Airlines. Our next connections back to Austria will take off from Washington, Mexico City, Cancun, Punta Cana and Havanna.

data.text: Stranded Austrians and people with a valid residence permit in Austria can now register for repatriation flights back to Vienna via https://t.co/iglSVDWuyC. To use this platform a general travel registration via https://t.co/YLGeKNoFVp is necessary. https://t.co/zeyZTxZuIy

RT @felix_loww: another COVID-19 video from @flughafen_wien 

@_austrian continues to operate special flights on behalf of the 🇦🇹 Governmen…

#Corona hat die Luftfahrt auf den Boden gezwungen. Der Flugverkehr in Europa steht, viele Fluglinien haben den Betrieb temporär eingestellt. Wie eine Airline oder ein Flughafen mit einer Krise umgeht, hat #Flightcast recherchiert (podcast in German only): https://t.co/tZ27lKUVru https://t.co/tmx5FDGFHb

Again many thanks to everyone who is working on the ground and up in the air during this difficult time! Thomas is one of our crew members who flew Austrians home from Marrakesh for @mfa_austria this week. 💪 🇦🇹 #WeAreAustrian #TeamÖsterreich https://t.co/cY9S9shn5x
Austrian Airlines Full Year Results 2019 https://t.co/yQd7g1BVjy
Notice: The conference will be held in German only.

data.text: This is no goodbye, it's a see you later. We'll be back! 🛫✌️ https://t.co/dbgxBvJOri

“Not all the airlines will survive this crisis. Austrian Airlines is better positioned than many other carriers. For this reason, we will emerge strengthened from this crisis. Who else if not us!?“, says CEO @AHoensbroech. https://t.co/ZxMfQ1Wbya

data.text: On the outlook for 2020: “The aviation sector is in an unprecedented crisis in its history. The coronavirus and its consequences will severely test us”, says Austrian Airlines CEO @AHoensbroech. https://t.co/XVbgUhhxqL

In 2019, we operated a total of 139,230 flights using 82 aircraft, or an average of about 380 flights per day. The regularity of operation in 2019 was up one percentage point to a gratifying 99.0 percent, whereas the punctuality rate on arrival equaled 80.6 percent (+ 1.5 pp). https://t.co/auDwYZJlzO

Austrian Airlines generated an adjusted EBIT of EUR 19 million in the 2019 financial year in spite of tough competition and extensive surplus capacities at Vienna Airport. In 2018 the adjusted EBIT was EUR 83 million. 14.7 million passengers flew with us, more than ever before. https://t.co/zmKYajme8d
RT @MFA_Austria: AM #Schallenberg: Mit dem heutigen 2. Tag der großen Rückholaktion konnten bereits mehr als 1300 Personen sicher nach 🇦🇹 g…
More retrieval flights today from Gran Canaria, Tenerife and Hurghada. @MFA_Austria  🙏✈️🇦🇹 https://t.co/CL7wpZnb2W
RT @MFA_Austria: Nützen Sie die Reiseregistrierung des Außenministeriums, damit wir Sie im Notfall rascher kontaktieren, informieren & unte…

The Austrian Federal Minister for Foreign Affairs just announced the biggest retrieval operation in history. As Austria's home airline, we are ready for this. In cooperation with @MFA_Austria, we will draw up a flight plan, continuously supplement and implement it accordingly. 🇦🇹 https://t.co/IaYyb3z2SX

We are aware that the current situation is extremely challenging for you and that you have many questions. Here's a quick explanation of the rebooking options of our extensive waiver policy. Please visit https://t.co/001CYjs86I for more information. https://t.co/tyLK1lzb1g

data.text: RT @lufthansaNews: #WeAreInThisTogether LUFTHANSA wird AUSTRIAN Airlines bestmöglich unterstützen. https://t.co/SbOwjy1zjq
Our contact form can be found here (bottom of the column): https://t.co/hxHKfAiaI3

Passengers can use of the contact form available on the Austrian Airlines Website at https://t.co/D0B55USJbx. Passengers who booked a flight before 16 March with a scheduled departure after 18 March will either be rebooked or else their fares will be refunded.

Tickets with a departure date before 30 April which were booked up until 12 March will be kept in abeyance and remain valid for the time being. Passengers will then have the chance up until 1 June to select a new travel date and, if need be, to choose another destination.

In this way, they will give the service employees the possibility to first deal with passengers who would normally be departing in the next week. These passengers will also be rebooked and correspondingly informed as needed. We are offering an expanded rebooking opportunity:

Austrian Airlines kindly asks passengers whose planned flights are not scheduled during the next seven days to refrain from contacting the service hotline in the days ahead but use our contact form on https://t.co/YLEBDoRZ3z for example.

“As Austria’s national carrier, we are aware of our responsibility and will cooperate with the government and try to bring home as many Austrians as possible”, says Austrian Airlines CEO @AHoensbroech.

If necessary, for example in cases of a need for evacuation and other relief or emergency flights, we will keep one long-haul aircraft and one medium-haul jet ready for operation. The relief flights will be carried out in close cooperation with the Austrian Federal Government.

Initially, Austrian Airlines will cancel all flights up until March 28, 2020. Passengers who have booked a flight during the time will be rebooked on other airlines if possible or receive a refund of their ticket price.

Austrian Airlines decided to temporarily terminate all regular flight operations starting Wednesday night, March 18, 2020. This move is in response to entry bans being imposed across the globe and a rapid decline in demand for air travel. https://t.co/OoSMxlyvIs
RT @AHoensbroech: Heute haben wir iA des Außenministeriums 60 Österreicher heimgebracht. Danke an die @_austrian Crew, die das freiwillig g…
Customers may use this option if their flight has been cancelled or if they wish to postpone their trip due to the current situation. No rebooking fees apply under the new waiver policy.

Austrian Airlines is extending its waiver policy. With immediate effect, tickets with a travel date up to 30 April 2020, booked up to March 12, can be suspended. Until 1 June, passengers can set a new travel date until 31 December 2020 and change the destination if desired. https://t.co/b9Y1DfQfic
As soon as we have received this official information, we will adjust our flight schedule accordingly and publish further information.

data.text: The Austrian Federal Government has announced to introduce a landing ban for flights from Spain, France and Switzerland as of Monday, 16 March 2020. Austrian Airlines is currently waiting for this announced regulation. https://t.co/n4rsFwHFRd
With the help of the Austrian Airlines chatbot, guests can easily select a new flight and change their reservations on their mobile phone. The chatbot is available at https://t.co/kADPH6n0O1.

Customers, who have provided their telephone number or e-mail address during the booking process, as well as members of the frequent flyer program Miles & More, will be automatically informed of changes in the flight program by SMS or e-mail.
Austrian Airlines asks all passengers who have booked a flight in the affected period to check the status of their flight on https://t.co/YLEBDoRZ3z under "My Bookings".

data.text: Our flights to Montreal, Canada, are currently not affected. The seasonal summer destination Los Angeles will be back on the flight schedule from the end of March at this time. However, further measures, which affect the summer flight schedule too, cannot be ruled out at present.

data.text: From Saturday 14 March there will no longer be any direct flights from Vienna to the USA until further notice, with the exception of Chicago. New York (EWR) will remain accessible via the Lufthansa hub in Frankfurt & the SWISS hub in Zurich. Both airlines will fly to Chicago too.

Due to the new US regulations, according to which passengers from the European Union, Switzerland and other countries are no longer allowed to enter the country, Austrian Airlines is changing its flight schedule to the United States. https://t.co/XsJt3WiiOA

If you have you booked your ticket through a travel agency, please contact them directly, as we cannot assist in this case. Please frequently check our latest travel updates, including our extensive rebooking options on https://t.co/YLEBDoRZ3z: https://t.co/k5ED4t8odt

Passengers who provided their telephone number or e-mail address during the booking procedure, as well as members of the frequent flyer program Miles & More, will be informed automatically via SMS or e-mail of flight changes.
Contact Maria – the Austrian Airlines Chatbot for general flight status, checking your booking and information on service-related questions: https://t.co/zhlorrbiPt

If you have sent us a request and we have not answered yet, please be patient and refrain from contacting us multiple times. Please check the status of your flight on https://t.co/YLEBDoRZ3z under “My Bookings”.

We have compiled a few tips to all our passengers out there trying to reach us due to a flight cancellation, rebooking requests, etc. In order to facilitate your contact request, we ask you to check the following information: https://t.co/ee34k7Hcao
We are currently evaluating the impact of the announced entry regulations on flight operations to the United States. We will inform you as soon as this review is completed. https://t.co/MOx5tM1hf9
https://t.co/F7Peye1Zg3

Customers, who have provided their telephone number or e-mail address during the booking process, as well as members of the frequent flyer program Miles & More, will be automatically informed of changes in the flight program by SMS or e-mail.

Passengers whose flights have been cancelled will be rebooked free of charge or receive a refund on request. Austrian Airlines asks all passengers who have booked a flight in the affected period to check the status of their flight on https://t.co/YLEBDp9zV7 under "My Bookings".
We apologize to all affected customers for the irregularities of the flight schedule and ask for their understanding.

“Unfortunately, due to the development of the coronavirus, we are forced to intervene in our flight program even more strongly and painfully than before. The situation remains complex. Therefore, we cannot rule out further measures", says Austrian Airlines CCO Andreas Otto.

data.text: Due to an official landing ban on flights from all over Italy, which came into effect today, Naples and Rome will no longer be served with immediate effect. As a result, the whole of Italy will no longer be served from today until further notice including Bologna, Milan & Venice.

As the situation surrounding the coronavirus remains tense and bookings continue to fall sharply, Austrian Airlines will make further adjustments to its flight schedule: In March and April, Austrian Airlines will cancel up to 50 percent of the entire flight offering in total. https://t.co/oyPKw7cD1U
Flying in times of COVID-19? You probably have many questions – we have compiled some facts and answers for you. https://t.co/rYpXhCdmYg

Customers who have provided their telephone number or e-mail address during the booking process, as well as members of the frequent flyer program Miles & More, will be automatically informed of changes in the flight program by SMS or e-mail.

Passengers whose flights have been cancelled will be rebooked, if possible, or will receive a refund. Austrian Airlines asks all passengers who have booked a connection in the affected period to check the status of their flight at https://t.co/YLEBDoRZ3z under "My bookings".

data.text: Our flight from #Larnaca #Cyprus to #Vienna just arrived safely at @flughafen_wien. On board: 168 passengers exclusively in female hands. We wish all of you a very Happy #WomensDay2020 #weltfrauentag2020 👩‍✈️👩‍✈️ https://t.co/2ROpG41Du7

Austrian Airlines offers extensive rebooking options free of charge: Newly purchased tickets can be rebooked until March 31 and bookings made before March 5, with a travel date until April 30, can be rebooked once to the same destination to a travel date until December 31, 2020. https://t.co/J6iTwKx8Sh
Passengers whose flights have been cancelled will be rebooked if possible or receive a refund. Customers can check the status of their flight on https://t.co/YLEBDoRZ3z under "My Bookings".
